name: places/ChIJLaicRJ9ZwokROtwheJTyfYs
formattedAddress: 225 Park Ave S, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 Park Ave S, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
I don't usually think to review banks, but I have to give kudos to the two lovely associates who literally saved my life today.

I rushed to stop by 20 minutes closing to draw a bank check for a new lease and then leave. That was supposed to be it; a quick in and out. However, while I was in the process of receiving assistance, I felt my blood sugars go low from the rapid walking I did to get to the location before closing. Or who knows what else it may have been -- as a type 1 diabetic, these episodes sometimes just happen sporadically.
Either way, I asked for candy, which the associate helping me asked her colleague for.

As I sucked on a jolly rancher, I realized it wasn't enough, because the numbers I went there for weren't making sense. So as the associate was helping me with that, I asked for literal powdered sugar. Amazingly enough, the other associate comes back in rapid succession with a huge pack of sugar, which I open and start pouring into my mouth. She keeps her cool and asks if I need anything else, an ambulance, water, etc. They even let me use the restroom and waited patiently for me to recover, even if it was after closing hours. The associate helping me with my financials corrected a mistake I had written down during my episode as well.

Unfortunately, I was so out of it, I didn't catch their names. All I could focus on was safely putting my check away and leaving so the ladies could close up, and also walking across the CVS to grab some extra sugar with fat to keep my sugars up on my trip home. Either way, to the two associates who work late on Thursdays, thank you. Your care and serious consideration of what may come off as easily dismissible made the world of a difference to me. It saved me from potentially passing out on the streets.

The value these associates showed me well represented the kind of care they give to their customers. I have no doubt that this is a stellar Flushing Bank location because of these staff members.

originalText.text: Been a client for many years, and the other day I was reminded why I changed banks all those years ago. Had some fraud committed with a check I'd mailed, and the staff of Flushing Bank could not have been any more helpful, knowledgeable, or committed to making things right. Smaller banks really are better, in so many ways. I'd imagine that not many people can honestly claim to really like their bank, but for me, it's the truth. They're the best.
